text: Kay Toinette Oslin (May 15, 1942 â€“ December 21, 2020) was an American country music singer-songwriter. She was best known for her 1987 top-ten hit country single "80's Ladies". Oslin was born in Crossett, Arkansas. She won three Grammy Awards (one in 1988 and two in 1989). In June 2015, she was diagnosed with Parkinson's disease. Oslin died on December 21, 2020, a week after being diagnosed with COVID-19 in Nashville, Tennessee, aged 78. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Tennessee Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American country singers Category:People with Parkinson's disease Category:Singers from Arkansas Category:Writers from Arkansas Category:American Grammy Award winners Category:BNA Records artists Category:RCA Records artists
title: K. T. Oslin
